events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection during rush hour.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident following review of the incident details and keywords referencing vehicle collision.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the file and provide personalized support to the claimant.
The claimant was sent a confirmation email acknowledging receipt of the accident claim and outlining the next steps.
Request was made for the claimant to submit police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
The claimant promptly submitted all requested documentation including official accident report and detailed vehicle damage photos.
An investigative team began evaluating the circumstances of the auto accident to determine liability and verify coverage terms.
The investigation confirmed the claimant was not at fault and verified consistency between damages and accident description.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the approved repair costs and coverage limits established in the policy.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the fair settlement offer and timely communication throughout the claim process.
The claim was officially approved, confirming full acceptance of the settlement terms by the insurer.
Claim payment was issued to the claimant's account to cover vehicle repairs as per the approved settlement.
Following payment confirmation, the auto accident claim file was officially closed with no pending issues.
The closed claim was archived in the company system for record-keeping and future reference if needed.
